project.name: config_tools_research
project.description: This document specifies the Gentoo Configuration Tools project.

longdescription.p: The config tools goals and specifications are here researched and defined. The development may be done in a seperate project, in a later time.

goals.p: This project is an attempt to design tools that will make Gentoo configuration more user friendly, although these tools don't necessarely have GUI frontends.

project.resource: Manifest, our set of rules and definitions on how to handle desktop research tasks

task.name: Gentoo config tools research
task.description: Research on the config tools topic

longdescription.p: This project is an attempt to design tools that will make Gentoo configuration more user friendly, although these tools don't necceserily have GUI frontends. This task is writing a description of what we want
A tool to select the services that should start/stop at specified runlevels. This tool is also able to start, stop and restart individual services.

task.name: Gentoo User Editor
task.description: Design a tool for maintaining a systems user database

longdescription.p: A tool the manage user accounts. In the first place only local users, later on support for ldap, etc. can be added. As a first version Fedora's user editor can be used, which provides support for local users only.

task.name: Gentoo Configuration Editor
task.description: Design a tool for maintaining a systems global configuration

longdescription.p: A tool designed for maintaining a systems global configuration, like make.conf, rc.conf, etc.

task.name: Gentoo Network Configuration Tool
task.description: Design a tool for configuring network connections

longdescription.p: A tool to simplify network configuration. I should be able to add interfaces (to net.ethX and /etc/conf.d/net), and configure them. At a later point PPP interface support can be added to configure (ADSL) modems.
